meanings.definition: The act or process of filtering.
meanings.sent1: I watched the filtration of coffee grounds from the liquid to make my morning brew.
meanings.sent2: The filtration of impurities from the water made it safe to drink.
meanings.sent3: The filtration of ideas in our brainstorming session helped us focus on the best ones.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness acted as a filtration, separating true friends from mere acquaintances.
meanings.sent5: The filtration of sunlight through the leaves created a beautiful pattern on the ground.

meanings.definition: The separation of solids from liquids by passing the mixture through a porous material.
meanings.sent1: The filtration of sand from water using a sieve was a fun science experiment.
meanings.sent2: The coffee filter allowed the filtration of fine coffee grounds, leaving a smooth brew.
meanings.sent3: The filtration of toys from the box by the toddler was a messy but adorable sight.
meanings.sent4: The mountain acted as a natural filtration, trapping debris and preventing it from reaching the valley.
meanings.sent5: The filtration of rainwater through the soil helped replenish the underground reservoir.
